events.name: Devfest Mumbai 2018

venue.name: WeWork Vikhroli West
venue.address_1: 13th Floor, 247 Park, Hindustan C. Bus Stop, LBS Rd, Gandhi Nagar, Vikhroli West,

events.description:
DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Googleâ€™s technologies. Hosted by Google Cloud Developer Community Mumbai and MADMeetup, Devfest Mumbai will cover multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and Mobile Web.

Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community that hosts it.
While no two events will be exactly alike, each event will, at its core, be powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen.

events.name: GDG MAD, November 2018 Meetup
events.description:
We're GDG MAD now!
Join us for our first meetup as a GDG, with three riveting talks, followed by our very first edition of Lets Build, an initiative which we'll tell you more about on the day!

Agenda
10:30AM - 11:00AM, Registration
11:00AM - 11:40AM, ""We build Empathy, not Just Models" by Avani Shah
11:40AM - 12:10PM, "try! Swift", by Yogesh Singh
12:10PM - 12:30PM, Break
12:30PM - 1:10PM, "PWAMP, the ðŸŽµ of AMP+PWA" by Rajat Chowdhary
1:10PM onwards, Lets Build, Consuming an API

The event is being held at Endurance International Group from 10:30AM to 2:30PM, with the exact venue and map link below. See you there!
events.how_to_find_us: The event is at Endurance International Group, Unit No. 501, 5th Floor, IT Building 3, Nesco IT Park, Nesco Complex, Western Express Highway, Goregaon (East), Mumbai 400 063

events.name: GDG MAD, February 2019 Meetup
events.description:
Agenda
10:30AM - 11:00AM, Registration
11:00AM - 11:40AM, "MLOps: Machine Learning in Production" by Prathamesh Sarang
11:40AM - 12:10PM, "Staying Motivated as a Developer" Roundtable Discussion

events.name: GDG MAD, March 2019 Meetup
events.description:
Agenda:

- 10:30AM - 11:00AM, Registration

- 11:00AM - 11:50AM, "Building a Modular SDK" by Tejas Sakpal.
Haptikâ€™s journey has been ride, in terms of both business as well as itâ€™s mobile technology. Initially Haptik started out with a goal of being a 24x7 Chat-based Personal Assistant to set reminders, book flights, pay your bills and get entertained! Now it is a B2B company providing services to various enterprises for Customer Service and Feedback, Lead Generation and User Engagement. In this talk, weâ€™ll learn about how the SDK was built, broken into multiple modules, challenges faced and how were they resolved and key aspects to keep in mind while developing SDKâ€™s.

- 11:50AM - 12:40PM, "Product Analytics 101" by Deesha Vora.

- 12:40PM - 1:20PM, Break

- 1:20PM - 1:40PM, "Visualising Protocols" by Viranchee Lotia.
We have a good idea of how the inheritance / object oriented programming works and we can visualise the child / parent relationships. Now, Kotlin and Swift are promoting many paradigms and the door gets opened to many design patterns.
Viranchee wants to try to help a developer visualise how protocols ( interfaces ) can be visualised.

- 1:40PM - 2:30PM, "PetLens - Making a visual pet search application using Flutter" by Javad Shaikh.
We will go through the concept of visual search, our current model architecture, and other possible solutions.
Then we'll go through the basics of flutter, most probably do some live coding (a simple layout)
Then we'll look at how to use ML models on android when using flutter and how we did it. (concepts and demo)

The event is being held at Innov8, MIDC, from 10:30AM to 2:30PM, with the exact venue and map link below. See you there!

events.name: Google I/O Extended Mumbai, 2019
events.description:
Google I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Googleâ€™s latest developer products. I/O Extended events help developers from around the world take part in the I/O experience.

GDG MAD is hosting Google I/O Extended again!
We're going to livestream the keynote, and hold talks and discussions leading up to it. Sign up to attend now, and be a part of the experience we recreate, halfway around the world.

The event begins at 7:00PM, with talks, networking and dinner, followed by the livestream of the keynote up to 12:00AM! We're back to 91Springboard our venue partner, which is located in Andheri East. We're working with DataGiri as our community partner!

Here's the full agenda:
7:00 - 7:40 - Registration
7:45 - 8:15 - Vishal Dubey: Reacting With Flutter
8:15 - 8:55 - Mayuresh Shilotri: Employee Churn Prediction Model
9:00 - 9:20 - Aniket Kadam: One way to Conference, and You Can Too
9:20 - 10:30- dinner and Networking
10:30 onward Live stream starts

Venue: https://goo.gl/maps/S6VUHZAK916g5cCz8

events.name: GDG MAD, Firebase Community Meetup
events.description:
The Google Firebase team is coming to Mumbai!
That's right, all the way from Mountain View, California, the team is in India to conduct Firebase Roadshows and Community Meetups, and they're going to be in Mumbai on the 30th of June for our very own communities, GDG MAD and GCDC Mumbai. Drop in for talks, interactions, or just to say hi to them.

===============================

Agenda:

- 10:00AM - 10:30AM, Registration

- 10:30AM - 11:30AM, "UXR for a Better Product" by Benjamin Ferrari-Church from the Google Firebase team

- 11:30AM - 12:30PM, "Empower Your App with Firebase Remote Config" by Mandar Deolalikar from the Google Firebase Team

- 12:30PM - 1:30PM, Break

- 1:30PM - 2:30PM, "Firestore Data Modeling" by Stefan Hogendoorn

events.name: GDG MAD, August 2019 Meetup
events.description:
The August meetup is here, precursor to the Devfest season. Join us at Pepperfry, Vikhroli on the 24th of August for talks on Android Q, Kotlin Coroutines and to meet awesome people!

Agenda:

- 10:00AM - 10:30AM, Registration

- 10:30AM - 11:30AM, "That's your Q" by Hussain Mukadam

- 11:30AM - 12:30PM, "Un-complicating Kotlin Coroutines" by Sagar Viradiya

- 12:30PM - 2:00PM, Networking Break

===============================

How to reach the venue:

* By Train: The nearest railway station is Vikhroli. You can take a shared autorickshaw (Rs. 10) or Bus (at minimum fare of Rs.5) to Surya Nagar. Embassy 247 is 100 meters from the Bus stop.

* By Metro: Get down at Ghatkopar and take an autorickshaw to Embassy 247 (~Rs. 70).

* By Private vehicle: We recommend you use public transport due to parking limitations at the venue. Although, get in touch with the organizers if you need any help regarding this.

events.name: GDG MAD, November 2019 Meetup
events.description:
We return, similar to the November rains, back from hibernation, and yes, we slept well, thanks for asking...NOT. Didn't you miss us? We missed us!
Join us at Rise Mumbai on the 23rd of November for sessions on product management, ARCore, and more!

Agenda:

â€¢ 10:00AM - 10:30AM, Registration

â€¢ 10:30AM to 11:30AM, "Panel Discussion: Taking the Leap into Product Management" By Ankita Kar from CleverTap and Rajesh Dhandapani from Pepperfry

â€¢ 11:30AM to 12:30AM, "Fun with ARCore" by and Raj H Raval and Krunal Gediya

â€¢ 1:00PM to 2:00PM, "Roundtable: Handling Emotions at Work"

===============================

How to reach the venue:

The event is being held at Rise Mumbai, on the 19th floor of the B Wing of Peninsula Business Park, Lower Parel. https://goo.gl/maps/LSox9rAjxAt9stAa7

â€¢ By train, the nearest station is Lower Parel, with the venue being a short 4 minute walk from the station

â€¢ By bus, the nearest bus stop is Dawn Mill, with the nearest major bus stop being Dadar TT, about an 11 minute taxi drive from the venue

â€¢ By private transport, there's no allocated visitor parking inside the venue, nor is there allocated street parking, so keep in mind that you'll have to find a parking spot on your own.
events.how_to_find_us: Rise Mumbai, 19th Floor, B Wing, Peninsula Business Park, Lower Parel

events.name: GDG MAD, Almost 2020 Meetup
events.description:
Yes, you're reading right. We actually put together a meetup in December. Well, almost a meetup.
Come join us for a year-end kinda-meetup at Grandmama's cafe, Dadar East, for avocado toast and hot chocolate, and of course, conversations, reminiscing and plans.
The "meetup" starts at 1, and doesn't have a fixed end time. You can get there earlier, but we won't be there so you'll have to sit by your lonesome, and you can leave early but we'll do our best to convince you to stay.

Given the location, we have limited seating, so we've enabled a waitlist and we'll confirm your attendance in the upcoming week.

events.name: GDG MAD, February 2020 Meetup
events.description:
Think of this as an open mic but for your careers! Hey, there's a real audience and all but just like comedians you won't get paid. This time we're going to BookMyShow on the 29th of February, to talk about blockchain and app bundles, as well as panel discussion by experts, the topic of which we can't tell you. Yet.

Agenda:

â€¢ 10:00AM - 10:30AM, Registration

â€¢ 10:30AM to 11:30AM, "Android App Bundles" by Akshansh Jain from BookMyShow

â€¢ 11:30AM to 12:30AM, "To Blockchain or Not" by Rashi Jaiswal from ZebPay

â€¢ 1:00PM to 2:00PM, Panel Discussion

===============================

How to get to the venue:

The event is being held at the BookMyShow office, at the Empressa Building in Andheri East: https://goo.gl/maps/KYvdoidxmu8dJKFp6

â€¢ By train, the nearest station is Andheri, with the venue being a short autorickshaw ride from the station.

â€¢ By metro, the nearest station is Western Express Highway, with the venue again being a short autorickshaw ride away.

â€¢ By private transport, there's no allocated visitor parking inside the venue, nor is there allocated street parking, so keep in mind that you'll have to find a parking spot on your own.

events.name: GDG MAD, March 2020 Meetup
events.description:
In a pandemic-struck world, a community of mortals come together to discuss their newly formed reality of working from their homes, something employers have always frowned upon. Watch as they join an open ended discussion on projects, side projects and their state of social distancing and isolation whilst munching on unhealthy snacks and begging to answer the question: is this the real life?

Agenda

1:30 PM IST - Online chat party and catching up with the community

2:30 PM IST - GitHub Actions for Android CI, a talk by Joe Birch

Meet link: https://meet.google.com/qyc-ktcj-ecf
